docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush is proposing to repeal and replace President Barack Obama's health care law with one that would increase tax credits for individuals, allowing them to buy coverage protection against "high-cost medical events."

headline.main: Bush Offers Plan to Repeal, Replace Federal Health Care Law

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton won unexpected support from chief rival Bernie Sanders on Tuesday for her use of a private email server as U.S. secretary of state, helping to defuse an issue that has overshadowed her campaign.

headline.main: Clinton Wins Rival's Backing Over Email Scandal in Democratic Debate
headline.print_headline: Clinton Wins Rival's Backing Over Email Scandal in Democratic Debate

docs.snippet: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton won unexpected support from chief rival Bernie Sanders on Tuesday for her use of a private email server as U.S. secretary of state, helping to defuse an issue that has overshadowed her campaign.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are several reasons people drop their insurance, but cost is clearly the big factor.

headline.main: How to Keep People in Health Plans
headline.print_headline: How to Keep People in Health Plans

docs.abstract: Editorial warns of steep drop in number of people who signed up for health insurance plans available through marketplaces created by Affordable Care Act, which poses challenge for industry as new open enrollment period begins in November; notes high costs of plans available is one of biggest contributing factors, particularly in light of many Republican governors refusing to expand Medicaid programs.
docs.snippet: There are several reasons people drop their insurance, but cost is clearly the big factor.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Some influential members of the conservative news media have turned on Representative Paul Ryan, whom Republicans are trying to draft for speaker of the House.

headline.main: Latest Unease on Right: Ryan Is Too Far Left
headline.print_headline: Latest Unease on Right: Ryan Is Too Far Left

docs.abstract: Some conservative Republicans, as Rep Paul D Ryan wrestles over whether to move to become next speaker of House, say he is too far left on variety of issues; he has mostly voted for measures to keep government open and debts fulfilled when many other Republicans vote against them.
docs.snippet: Some influential members of the conservative news media have turned on Representative Paul Ryan, whom Republicans are trying to draft for speaker of the House.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tools being added to the federal health care website are intended to make it easier for people to find plans that include their doctors and to estimate costs.

headline.print_headline: As Consumers Face Complex Choices, HealthCare.gov Will Get a Makeover

docs.abstract: Obama administration's HealthCare.gov website will undergo makeover in effort to make it easier for consumers to compare health insurance plans and costs.
docs.snippet: Tools being added to the federal health care website are intended to make it easier for people to find plans that include their doctors and to estimate costs.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The socioeconomic divide helps determine who gets to grow old, researchers have found. Living longer, high earners take home more in federal benefits.

headline.main: Income Inequality Grows With Age and Shapes Later Years

docs.abstract: Research shows persistent life-expectancy gap between highest-earners in population and those at bottom of socioeconomic ladder; income differences contribute to variety of factors, including physical environment, health care and Social Security benefits, that affect longevity.
docs.snippet: The socioeconomic divide helps determine who gets to grow old, researchers have found. Living longer, high earners take home more in federal benefits.

keywords.value: The End Game: How Inequality Shapes Our Final Years (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush on Tuesday will lay out proposals to repeal President Barack Obama's healthcare law and replace it with a system that provides a tax credit for the purchase of health plans and shifts power to the states.
